'''Yanma''' ([[List of Japanese Pokémon names|Japanese]]: '''ヤンヤンマ''' ''Yanyanma'') is a dual-type {{2t|Bug|Flying}} {{OBP|Pokémon|species}} introduced in [[Generation II]].

It [[Evolution|evolve]]s into {{p|Yanmega}} when [[level]]ed up while knowing {{m|Ancient Power}}.

==Biology==
Yanma is a large, red dragonfly Pokémon. Compared to its long, thin abdomen, its thorax is short and wide. It has three pairs of two-toed legs and two pairs of wings with red bands on them. A bright green mask marking covers most of its face, and it has two spikes on top of its head. Its blue eyes can see all around its body allowing it to have a high evasiveness. The end of Yanma's tail has two flat extensions from the sides and two gray spikes in the center.

Yanma is a skillful flier. It can make sudden stops, turn in midair and hover in place by flapping its wings at a high speed. It can also generate shock waves capable of breaking glass by flapping its wings very fast. Yanma is often found in {{DL|List of Pokémon by habitat|Forest Pokémon|wooded and swampy areas}}. It hunts insects for food, using its eyesight to spot and its flight abilities to pursue prey. Yanma is also territorial, flitting around to guard its territory.

==In the anime==
[[File:Jessie Yanma.png|thumb|left|220px|Yanma in the {{pkmn|anime}}]]
===Major appearances===
====[[Jessie's Yanma]]====
In ''[[DP080|The Thief That Keeps on Thieving!]]'', a rookie {{pkmn|Trainer}} named [[Tyler]] was about to capture a Yanma that his {{p|Piplup}} had weakened, when Team Rocket showed up and [[Jessie]] captured it instead. They sent it to {{an|Giovanni}}; however, {{TRT}} already had obtained a large number of Yanma and so Giovanni returned it to them. When Jessie used Yanma in battle, it used {{m|AncientPower}} and evolved into a Yanmega. During this time, another weakened Yanma got away. A third Yanma appeared afterwards, and Tyler finally captured that one.

====Other====
Yanma debuted in ''[[EP177|Wings n' Things]]'', under the ownership of [[Zachary Evans]]. It was carelessly breaking glass in a town.

A Yanma appeared in ''[[AG014|All in a Day's Wurmple]]'', under the ownership of [[Forrester Franklin]].

===Minor appearances===
A Yanma made a cameo in ''[[PK10|Pikachu's PikaBoo]]''.

A Yanma appeared in ''[[M05|Pokémon Heroes: Latios & Latias]]'' as one of the Pokémon residing in Latios and Latias' garden. Multiple Yanma also appeared in the same movie, where they flew over the [[Tour de Alto Mare]] competitors.

Multiple Yanma appeared in ''[[M08|Lucario and the Mystery of Mew]]'' as some of the Pokémon living in the [[Tree of Beginning]]. Also, one appeared in the opening sequence of the movie.

A Yanma appeared in ''[[AG080|That's Just Swellow]]'', where it was used in the [[Crossgate Town]] [[PokéRinger]] where it competed against a {{p|Wingull}}, {{p|Swablu}}, and {{p|Pelipper}}

A group of Yanma appeared in ''[[M10|The Rise of Darkrai]]''.

A Yanma appeared in ''[[DP071|Pokémon Ranger and the Kidnapped Riolu! Part One]]''.

Multiple Yanma made a cameo in ''[[M12|Arceus and the Jewel of Life]]''.

Multiple Yanma appeared in ''[[M13|Zoroark: Master of Illusions]]'' as some of the many local Pokémon living in [[Crown City]]. Three of them surrounded {{OBP|Zorua|M13}} in the park alongside several other Pokémon, with the intent of attacking him in retribution for what {{OBP|Zoroark|M13}} did to the city. Before a fight could break out, the Yanma, along with the other Pokémon, were calmed down by {{OBP|Celebi|M13}}.

==In the manga==
===In the Pokémon Adventures manga===
[[File:Indigo Plateau Adventures.png|thumb|Yanma in [[Pokémon Adventures]]]]
A Trainer's Yanma was seen in ''[[PS153|Butterfly Butterfree]]''.

A trio of Yanma were accidentally let loose in ''[[PS154|Yikes, It's Yanma!]]'', causing minor chaos at the [[Indigo Plateau]] by taking an infant hostage. {{adv|Gold}} quelled them by taking advantage of their near-360-degree vision with {{DL|Gold (Adventures)|Sudobo}}'s Poké Ball, and then successfully rescued the child.

A Yanma was one of the Pokémon sent to help the fight in [[Ilex Forest]] in ''[[PS179|The Last Battle XIII]]''.

===In the Pokémon Gotta Catch 'Em All manga===
[[Shu]] has a Yanma in the [[Pokémon Gotta Catch 'Em All]] manga.

==Trivia==
* Yanma weighs exactly the same as {{ga|Lucas}}. It shares this characteristic with {{p|Sudowoodo}}, {{p|Skuntank}}, {{p|Togekiss}}, and {{p|Fearow}}.
* Yanma shares the same base {{stat|Speed}} stat with its evolved form, {{p|Yanmega}}.

===Origin===
Yanma is based on a {{wp|dragonfly}}, possibly the {{wp|red-veined darter}}. Because of its size and weight, it might have been inspired by extinct giant dragonflies in the ''{{wp|Meganeura}}'' genus.

====Name origin====
Yanma and Yanyanma derive from 蜻蜓 ''yanma'' (large dragonfly).
